content.en: Knee MRI Evaluation: Researchers have been investigating the use of different MRI sequences and techniques to accurately evaluate and diagnose knee derangements. They have compared the diagnostic performance of various sequences, such as 3D isotropic resolution fast spin-echo and vastly undersampled isotropic projection steady-state free precession, to routine MRI protocols. Additionally, they have explored the clinical value and image quality parameters of different sequences, including isotropic three-dimensional cartilage-imaging MRI sequences. Algorithms have played a crucial role in evaluating the accuracy, repeatability, and utility of these MRI sequences for assessing knee joint conditions.
content.da: Kne-MRI-evaluering: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af forskellige MRI-sekvenser og -teknikker for nøjagtigt at evaluere og diagnosticere knælidelser. De har sammenlignet den diagnostiske ydeevne af forskellige sekvenser, såsom 3D-isotropisk opløsning hurtig spin-echo og stærkt undersamplet isotropisk projektion steady-state free precession, med rutinemæssige MRI-protokoller. Derudover har de undersøgt den kliniske værdi og billedkvalitetsparametrene for forskellige sekvenser, inklusive isotropiske tredimensionelle bruskbilleddannende MRI-sekvenser. Algoritmer har spillet en afgørende rolle i at evaluere nøjagtigheden, gentageligheden og nytten af disse MRI-sekvenser til vurdering af knæledstilstande.
